text: Making Almond Cherry Fudge Prepare the baking pan. Grease, then line with greaseproof paper or cling wrap, a 20 centimeter (7.9 in) square baking dish. Place the sweetened condensed milk and cooking chocolate into a saucepan. Place on the stove top and melt the ingredients together over a gentle heat, stirring now and then. Alternatively, place in a microwave proof bowl and microwave on high for two minutes. Remove from the heat source. Beat together well for 1 minute. Add the flaked almonds, glazed cherries and almond extract to the mixture. Stir through well. Pour the fudge mixture into the prepared pan. Use the back of a spoon or a spatula to spread across the dish evenly. Place in the refrigerator. Chill until it sets. Cut into squares or finger lengths when set. Place half a glazed cherry on top of each square when cut. Serve. Or, wrap in food cellophane and pack into a gift box or basket. Making White Chocolate Cherry Fudge Prepare the baking pan. Grease, then line with greaseproof paper or cling wrap, a 20 centimeter (7.9 in) square baking dish. Melt the chocolate first. Place the white chocolate drops or pieces into the saucepan. Heat gently to melt. Stir frequently to help the mixture turn smooth. See almond cherry fudge above for the microwave method. Remove the mixture from the heat when the chocolate has melted. Add the food coloring (if using), cherry extract and cherries. Pour the fudge mixture into the prepared pan. Use the back of a spoon or a spatula to spread across the dish evenly. Place in the refrigerator. Chill for at least 2 hours, or until it sets. Cut into squares or finger lengths when set. Place half a glazed cherry on top of each square when cut. Serve. Or, wrap in food cellophane and pack into a gift box or basket
